location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 140: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell forwards a copy of a letter (see ff.52-53), dated 15 March 1850, from Her Majesty's Minister at the Court of Persia, Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil, which was written in response to Hennell's letter of 6 February 1850, no. 57, on the subject of the course to be taken regarding the Dashty vessel which brought up a cargo of slaves to Mohumrah [Khorramshahr, Iran].
